</p></div></div><h2 id="bd09154e-7a37-424c-85ac-e67e4b735958" class="">💼Professional experience - projects</h2><ul id="5e493dfd-c8fd-4850-94b8-be76f44cc143" class="toggle"><li><details open=""><summary><strong>Transformation of Monolitic Delivery App to Microservices Architecture</strong></summary><ul id="bf993dbd-8c9b-433b-8fcc-1e8e5c54c5d5" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc"><strong>Description: </strong>Transformed a legacy Super App platform from a monolithic architecture to a microservices-based model, addressing performance issues and optimizing scalability. The platform, initially developed in PHP, lacked the ability to efficiently handle a growing user base, especially in a cost-effective manner in the cloud environment.</li></ul><ul id="bfcbe7aa-ff4e-43fc-95d0-5a428af4412f" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc"><strong>Position/role: </strong>Back End Developer, Cloud Architect, DevOps</li></ul><ul id="9ad8adf4-5849-4a32-9d5b-1f63a6890f50" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc"><strong>Responsibilities and Achievements:</strong> <ul id="4b2c4fe1-8bf8-404a-9760-9d11f359e8e6" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Analysed the existing monolithic solution to identify performance bottlenecks and scalability challenges.</li></ul><ul id="625578a7-0540-49e0-ac4b-f4e29707962b" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Proposed and designed a microservices architecture to enhance overall app performance and scalability.</li></ul><ul id="ba9e9cfa-3674-4b3a-90bf-3a0242ba6b67" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Developed microservices from scratch using NodeJS and ExpressJS, ensuring compatibility with Web, Android, and iOS applications.</li></ul><ul id="ac0e89f7-a988-47ba-8abe-d037048548f0" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Implemented a dedicated images microservice, reducing the load on the main server and enhancing system efficiency.</li></ul><ul id="cefce1e8-29ea-4ad9-a8a0-3d64bf28f058" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Leveraged GCP (Google Cloud Platform) for hosting microservices and optimizing resource utilization.</li></ul><ul id="a23a72b4-27b5-4c07-99d8-8000e1fad3c6" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Maintained compatibility by exposing the same HTTP resources as the previous PHP-based services, ensuring a seamless transition for clients.</li></ul><ul id="2dcdea8c-d0de-465a-bf80-b04dd8133e25" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Achieved significant performance improvements, addressing the challenge of accommodating a large number of concurrent users.</li></ul></li></ul><ul id="d77e856b-eae9-43db-b3af-86d5ce12413f" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc"><strong>Technologies/frameworks: </strong><code><strong>NodeJs, ExpressJS, MySql, Google Cloud Functions, Google Cloud Run, Google Cloud Storage, Google Cloud Sql, Google Cloud PubSub, Google Cloud Compute Engine, Google Cloud Build, Bitbucket, PHP, Docker</strong></code><strong> </strong></li></ul></details></li></ul><ul id="20c5fc30-7088-4fbe-8029-6f8b65457c56" class="toggle"><li><details open=""><summary><strong>Scraping system for store product data on Delivery App</strong></summary><ul id="e15db6ec-0c70-42bb-b944-29a5ed56a1d0" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc"><strong>Description: </strong>Developed a scraping system to gather product data from popular stores, enhancing the company&#x27;s delivery application for users. The objective was to create a microservice capable of retrieving comprehensive information about products and promotions from various stores and updating the data within the company&#x27;s delivery application.</li></ul><ul id="d2c84e0a-22b9-4b90-8b2c-a5f8936f69c9" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc"><strong>Position/role: </strong>Back End Developer, Cloud Architech, DevOps</li></ul><ul id="97ed5f63-ab97-4f18-8b38-3299c86f2d7f" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc"><strong>Responsibilities and Achievements:</strong> <ul id="cadca578-f4fc-4642-97ec-fd077a8b6c3e" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Evaluated the existing microservice and presented a proposal for a new version with improvements in automation, independence, and overall architecture.</li></ul><ul id="ee50ad99-e5ff-4304-8bbb-4f08672f2560" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Developed new scripts to extract data from additional stores and integrated them into the microservice.</li></ul><ul id="42f39761-b694-4cb7-943f-416dd4036a11" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Utilized NodeJs and Typescript for efficient script execution and flexibility in handling diverse data sources.</li></ul><ul id="30f0ef0c-58c6-4596-b755-fa8b5c8cb58e" class="bulleted-list"><li id="8a73772e-ed00-400a-8e72-2f2e34ddf6bc" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Orchestrated microservices communication through events, fostering a seamless and efficient architecture.</li></ul><ul id="23232980-7be9-45b3-a64f-af0e8cd24d76" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Leveraged Google Cloud Platform (GCP) for robust hosting and scalable infrastructure.</li></ul><ul id="cc5fec59-c0fe-455c-9cce-293c2e73f8a4" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Contributed to enhancing the microservice&#x27;s capabilities in automating data updates and ensuring independence from specific store implementations.</li></ul></li></ul><ul id="0534a1dc-636f-4f4c-a8bb-dc300834f51f" class="bulleted-list"><li Cloud Sql, Google Cloud PubSub, Google Cloud Compute Engine, Google Cloud Build, Bitbucket, Docker, Mongo DB</strong></code><strong> </strong></li></ul></details></li></ul><ul id="7a9b756e-1d89-4daa-8512-5da08e93872b" class="toggle"><li><details open=""><summary><strong><strong>Transformation of Monolithic Java App for Google Workspace Marketplace into a NodeJS Microservices Architecture</strong></strong></summary><ul id="c1f7950f-070a-4a10-8ccc-934561fe0a3c" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc"><strong>Description: </strong>Worked the transformation of a monolithic Java application, utilized within the Google Workspace Marketplace, into a modern microservices architecture powered by NodeJS. The focus of the project was to migrate building technologies for a Google Workspace application that managed email signatures for companies. The company aimed to transition from Java to NodeJS and embrace a serverless architecture.</li></ul><ul id="a5bffefa-1dac-4ff7-b539-faa4fdf97f8d" class="bulleted-list"><li designed new microservices to align with the NodeJS technology stack and adhere to a serverless architecture.</li></ul><ul id="041f2c53-5c73-4369-bbe7-08e8a39c7d20" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Orchestrated the migration of the application&#x27;s technologies, ensuring a seamless transition and minimal disruption to existing functionalities.</li></ul><ul id="837a3e7f-ffec-463b-9165-7a089ca6418e" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Implemented microservices in NodeJS, leveraging Typescript and ExpressJS for enhanced development efficiency.</li></ul><ul id="d1ba86ef-6828-4d92-8f85-379c4a5f9d67" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Utilized Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Google Cloud Run for APIs and Google Cloud Functions for event management via PubSub.</li></ul><ul id="33341694-e350-439c-aefd-6bc7c78b879f" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:circle">Established
